  • Element
persistence

Annotation Type PersistAnnotation


  • @Inherited
@Target(value={TYPE,FIELD})
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
public @interface PersistAnnotation
    Annotation referenced by the Persistence API to retrieve user defined meta-data. This annotation can be annotated on class-level or field-level with the latter being prioritised by the Persistence API during serialization.
    The user defined meta-data possible are:
    • persist - Click on persist() for more details.
    • cascade - Click on cascade() for more details.
    • type - Click on type() for more details.
    Example of annotation usage: 
            @PersistAnnotation(cascade = {CascadeType.Create})
        public class ExampleModel extends Entity {
                
                // This field will not be persisted.
                @PersistAnnotation(persist = false)
                private boolean nopersist;
 
                // This field will default to no cascade as the field annotation will override
                // the class-level annotation.
                @PersistAnnotation
                private ExampleModel nocascade;
 
                // This field will inherit its parent's cascade policy.
                private ExampleModel cascadecreate;
 
                // This field will be persisted as ExampleModel and any operations performed on its parent will be cascaded.
                @PersistAnnotation(
                        type = ExampleModel.class,
                        cascade = {CascadeType.Create, CascadeType.Update, CascadeType.Delete}
                )
                private List<ExampleModel> cascadeall;
 
        }
    Author:
    YingHao

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      CascadeType[] cascade
      Indicates the possible cascade operations of the fields belonging to a class (class-level) or a specific field (field-level).
      boolean persist
      Indicates if a specific field can be persisted.
      Class<?> type
      Indicates the type of a specific field.

    • Element Detail

      • persist

        public abstract boolean persist
        Indicates if a specific field can be persisted. This declaration can only be used in field declaration. This declaration takes precedence over cascade declaration, that is if persist is false any cascade operations specified will not be considered. Defaults to true.
        Default:
        true

      • cascade

        public abstract CascadeType[] cascade
        Indicates the possible cascade operations of the fields belonging to a class (class-level) or a specific field (field-level). Defaults to no cascade operations.
        Default:
        {}

      • type

        public abstract Class<?> type
        Indicates the type of a specific field. This declaration is required for fields containing a Collection. This has no effect for class-level declaration and fields that are not of Collection types.
        Default:
        persistence.Entity.class
